item.title: Rural Villa in Eccles
item.description: Province Britannia Province Description Location Eccles Eccles (Pleiades) Location Description Sublocation Sublocation Description Garden Rural Villa in Eccles Keywords archaeological garden ditches drains horticultural containers piscinae rural villas villae rusticae water baths Garden Description This country estate in modern Kent possessed a large ornamental pool (P in Fig. 1) in the area in front of the main residence (A in Fig. 1) and to the east of the attached bath house (Fig. 1). The masonry pool measuring 25 x 3.50 meters lay parallel to the house frontage. From the pool ran a masonry drain. Although no traces of bedding trenches or plantings have been detected in the yard around the pool, it might be assumed that the pool was a centerpiece of a garden (G in Fig. 1). Interestingly, in the backfill of a ditch under the southeast wing of the villa at least thirty planting pots were retrieved in excavations.
